intro: Bunium wolffii, commonly known as the Siberian fennel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its seeds are enclosed in a structure called a schizocarp, which splits into two parts when mature. Bunium wolffii is native to Central Asia and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
